description: A guide or manual outlining the processes, procedures, and best practices for procurement contracts within an organization.
A method of dispute resolution involving one or more neutral third parties who render a binding or non-binding decision.
The process of resolving conflicts or disagreements between parties, which may include negotiation, mediation, arbitration, or litigation.
The transfer of rights, obligations, or duties under a contract from one party to another.
The act of replacing an obligation to perform with a new obligation, or replacing a party to an agreement with a new party.
A change in the controlling ownership of a company, often triggered by a merger, acquisition, or other corporate transaction.
The process of determining the meaning of the terms and provisions of a contract.
A clause in a contract that limits the amount or type of damages for which a party may be liable.
A contractual obligation requiring a party to use its best endeavors to perform its obligations.
A contractual obligation requiring a party to take actions that are commercially reasonable to perform its obligations.
The principle that a party who has suffered damages as a result of a breach of contract has a duty to take reasonable steps to minimize the extent of the loss.
The act of transferring ownership of goods or property from one party to another.
Estimating or predicting future events or trends, often used in business for planning and resource allocation.
The obligations and duties of a vendor or supplier in a contractual relationship, including quality, delivery, and other performance standards.
